q_en: What materials were used in Olivia's order?
gt:
Sure! Let's dive into Olivia's order and see what materials were used. Here's a breakdown of the original materials for each product in her order:

| **Product ID** | **WIP Material ID** | **Original Material ID** | **Quantity** |
|----------------|---------------------|--------------------------|--------------|
| 18             | 10                  | 9                        | 0.6          |
|                |                     | 1                        | 0.35         |
|                |                     | 13                       | 0.8          |
|                | 6                   | 5                        | 0.75         |
|                |                     | 1                        | 0.4          |
|                | 2                   | 1                        | 0.4          |
|                |                     | 11                       | 0.65         |
|                |                     | 3                        | 0.2          |
| 17             | 4                   | 3                        | 0.5          |
|                |                     | 14                       | 0.15         |
|                |                     | 13                       | 0.3          |
|                | 12                  | 11                       | 0.7          |
|                |                     | 1                        | 0.5          |
| 10             | 8                   | 7                        | 1.0          |
|                |                     | 9                        | 0.2          |
|                |                     | 5                        | 0.1          |

I hope this helps you understand what materials were used in Olivia's order! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. üòä

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'Olivia';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "Olivia"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '7';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for the orders placed by the customer "Olivia"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN ('7');
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs for the orders placed by "Olivia"

steps.sql: SELECT product_id FROM order_product WHERE id IN ('25', '26', '27');
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs associated with the order_products

steps.sql: SELECT material_id, number FROM product_material WHERE product_id IN ('18', '17', '10');
steps.description: Retrieve the material IDs and quantities used for the products in "Olivia's" orders

steps.sql: SELECT name FROM materials WHERE id IN ('8', '12', '6', '4', '10', '2');
steps.description: Retrieve the material names for the material IDs

response:
Sure thing! Let's dive into Olivia's order and see what materials were used. Here's a breakdown of the materials and their quantities:

| Material Name            | Quantity Used |
|--------------------------|---------------|
| Fabric Pieces            | 3             |
| Wool Pieces              | 4             |
| Silk Pieces              | 6             |
| Leather Pieces           | 2             |
| Synthetic Fiber Pieces   | 4             |
| Denim Fabric Pieces      | 3             |

It looks like Olivia's order was quite diverse in materials! If you have any more questions or need further details, feel free to ask. üòä
